title: High Short-term Debt Reliance
description: In 2023, Zimbabwe's short-term debt reached 3409.7% of its total reserves, indicating a significant reliance on short-term borrowing.

title: Rapid Domestic Economic Claims Growth
description: Claims on other sectors of the domestic economy grew by 453.9% of broad money in 2023, reflecting a robust expansion in domestic financial activities.

title: Negative Net Foreign Assets
description: Zimbabwe's net foreign assets stood at a negative value of -18.86 trillion LCU in 2023, highlighting a significant foreign liability.

title: Strong Private Sector Credit Growth
description: In 2023, claims on the private sector grew by 425.5% of broad money, indicating a strong credit expansion to private entities.

title: Surging Broad Money Growth
description: Broad money in Zimbabwe grew by 708.9% in 2023, suggesting a rapid increase in the money supply.

title: Extremely High Lending Interest Rate
description: The lending interest rate in Zimbabwe reached 170.3% in 2023, one of the highest globally, posing challenges for borrowers.

title: Wide Interest Rate Spread
description: In 2023, the interest rate spread in Zimbabwe was 107.5%, indicating a significant difference between lending and deposit rates.

title: Negative Real Interest Rate
description: The real interest rate in Zimbabwe was -73.5% in 2023, suggesting that inflation significantly outpaced nominal interest rates.

title: Strong National Income Growth
description: Adjusted net national income grew by 39% in 2021, indicating a robust increase in the country's economic wealth.

title: Rising Income Per Capita
description: In 2021, adjusted net national income per capita grew by 36.6%, reflecting an improvement in individual economic well-being.

title: Hyperinflationary Environment
description: Zimbabwe experienced an inflation rate of 921.5% in 2023, as measured by the GDP deflator, indicating a hyperinflationary environment.

title: Social Protection Benefits to Poorest Quintile
description: In 2019, 37.6% of social protection and labor program benefits were directed to the poorest quintile, highlighting targeted social support.

title: Low Health Expenditure Impact on Poverty
description: Only 1.82% of the population was pushed further below the poverty line due to out-of-pocket health care expenses in 2017, indicating limited financial burden from health costs.

title: Moderate Tariff Rates on Manufactured Products
description: In 2016, 5.9% of tariff lines on manufactured products had specific rates, reflecting moderate protectionism in trade policy.
